definition.name: NXebeam_column
definition.doc: Base class for a set of components providing a controllable electron beam.

field.name: operation_mode
field.doc:
Typically tech-partner, microscope-, and control software-specific name of the specific operation mode how the ebeam_column and its components are controlled to achieve a specific illumination condition on the specimen.
In many cases the users of an instrument do not know or are responsible for knowing all the detailed spatiotemporal dynamics of their hardware. Instead, they rely on the assumption that the instrument and its control software works as expected and thus can be used for research.
Selecting then a specific operation_mode assures some level of reproducibility in the illumination conditions even though that the exact details of how the electron beam is deflected and shaped does not matter.

group.name: electron_source
group.doc:
The source which creates the electron beam.
The hardware for an electron source in an electron microscope may contain several components which affect the beam path.

field.name: voltage
field.doc: Voltage relevant to compute the energy of the electrons immediately after they left the source. This source is not the source point.

field.name: emitter_type
field.doc:
Emitter type used to create the beam.
If the emitter type is other, give further details in the description field.

field.name: emitter_material
field.doc: Material of which the emitter is build, e.g. the filament material.

field.name: description
field.doc: Free-text field to store further details about the source.

field.name: lifetime
field.doc: How long has the source been in operation.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the component in the instrument.

Individual characterization results for the position, shape, and characteristics of the electron beam in certain locations.
:ref:`NXtransformations` should be used to specify the location of the position at which the beam was probed.
